intro: Epilobium sadae, commonly known as the Sadae willowherb, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Epilobium sadae is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
